entry.title: Re: MIGO BADI in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud
entry.content:
Hi @yashoratna .

I have implemented and successfully triggered two BADIs in the standard app Post Goods Receipt for Purchasing Document that might be very useful for your case:

MMIM_GR4XY_PROVIDE_DATA – triggered when entering or changing a purchasing document in the standard app Post Goods Receipt for Purchasing Document. You can use it to modify data at both header and item levels.

MMIM_GR4XY_CHECK_DATA – triggered when posting the purchasing document. You can use it to perform validations and raise messages if needed.



Follow these steps to implement these BADIs:


1. Go to the Custom Logic app
2. Create a new implementation
3. Search by BADI ID "MMIM_GR4XY" or by Business Context "Inventory Management: Goods Receipt for Fiori apps"


4. Select the BADI you want to implement
5. Write your validation or enhancement logic and publish it

BR,
Alexandre

entry.title: Re: Forward propagation not working when importing pay ra...
entry.content:
Hello,

Yes, this is normal behavior in SAP SuccessFactors. When you import new pay ranges (or other changes) with retroactive (back-dated) effective dates, forward propagation does not always occur—especially if there are already future-dated records that create a "break" or a value mismatch in the relevant field. Forward propagation in Employee Central typically stops when a future record already exists with a different value or when a manually-maintained change for that field has occurred at a future effective date

Thanks

entry.title: Re: How to short automatic packing HU in putaway
entry.content:
Hello @imel_99 

My apologies for the late reply.

To ensure I provide you with the most accurate guidance, please confirm below.

  1. Are you using standard outbound delivery processing, or is embedded EWM active in your system?
  2. Do you expect the system to allow partial Handling Units, or should it strictly create only full HUs?
  3. Are you packing purely based on material and quantity, or are you considering other factors such as batch or customer-specific rules?

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Publishing Custom Field "New Grade" from SAP SuccessF...
entry.content:
Hi @RavindraSharma 

As far as I know at this time publishing information back to Job Info is only possible when Promotion is enabled on the worksheet (= fields are edited from the promotion popup). Which means I am not sure your design will work here.

The xml code is as follows, it needs to be at the bottom of the publish back block (after anything for compInfo, recurring PC and non-reccuring PC). Note that the comp-hris-field-map block with customField2 in it is only if you want to customize the date to be different based on a specific attribute : you build a custom column in design worksheet with a lookup table and use that as publish back date).

entry.title: SAP Integration Suite – Update Version of an Integration Flow Component
entry.content:
Introduction 

SAP Cloud Integration version 5.75/7.40, 6.67/ (8.x→ 8.31), one of the capabilities of SAP Integration Suite, comes with a feature which will allow you to update the version of an integration flow component.  To know more, you can refer the help documentation.

In this blog, I will cover the detailed aspects of this feature, which pain, problem it will address and how to leverage this feature to improve the developer productivity and efficiency. 

But before that lets try to understand the need for the versioning of the components.

In SAP Cloud Integration, new version is created when a component, which is already shipped and is being used by the customers undergoes some changes, enhancements, improvements. New features are offered in this component via the minor version updates and small fixes like label changes or UI alignments are offered via micro version updates. To know the versioning of the components in detail, refer the “Versioning of Components” section from this blog post.

Problem 

Manual update of component version is inefficient. Integration Developers face significant challenges when updating the version of the components manually.

Integration Developer​

Manual update of the component is a multi-step process as described below:

  1. Manual component deletion​ - Manual update involves deleting component (Flow steps, Adapters etc.). 
  2. Recreation of component - After deletion, integration developer must recreate component manually, and maintain their configurations, including properties and externalized parameters.

These manual steps are Effort-Intensive, and the process is time-consuming, cumbersome and error prone.

Solution

Enabled one-click update version feature to update the component which is backward compatible to the latest available version without any loss of the existing properties, configurations, externalized parameters etc. In past we had enabled this feature for the Integration flow configuration, process pool elements, however in this release, the framework is extended to enable the feature to update the flow steps, adapters which are the widely used components in the modeling of integration flow artifact.

This feature is available across all the environments of the Cloud Integration such as NEO, CF and Edge Integration Cell. Feature applicability - Flow steps and Adapters.

To know more about Runtime Profile, refer this help documentation and blog post.

How it works?

A dedicated “Update Version” will be available if the component version is older than the latest available version corresponding to the runtime profile (e.g. SAP Cloud Integration, Edge Integration Cell etc.). Backward-compatible components will be migrated to the latest version seamlessly. When you update the version, existing fields will be retained with the same values, and new fields will be populated with default values. If a default value is not present for a mandatory field, you must add the value, and new fields will be populated with default values. If a default value is not present for a mandatory field, you must add the value.

Flow step - Content modifier version 1.5 is selected for the update. Image: 1

Update Version feature updates the Content Modifier from 1.5 to 1.6 (latest version) as it contains the backward compatible changes.

Image: 2

Content Modifier flow step is updated to the latest version and now the Update Version feature is not available as the component is on the latest version.


Image: 3

If the components are not backward compatible, they will not be updated rather the feature will educate Integration Developer to delete and recreate the components by maintaining the configurations manually. See the below example.

Generate Splitter flow step cannot be updated from 1.5 to 1.6 as it contains incompatible changes. 

Image: 4

Integration Developer will be asked to delete and recreate the component manually.Image: 5

Note: You can update one only component (Flow step, Adapter, Process) at a time. Selecting an integration process focuses the update exclusively on that process.

Benefits

  • Eliminates manual recreation of flow steps ​.
  • Saves time & reduces effort​.
  • Minimize errors​.
  • Keep components latest.
  • Improve developer efficiency and productivity​.

This enhancement is designed to make integration process development easier by enabling the integration developers to access the latest features through seamless updates of integration flow adapters and flow steps.

Next steps

  • Show “Change” summary in the Update Version UI.​
  • Update “Process” component and its child elements.

 

Hope you will be benefited with this feature. Please experience the Update Version and provide your valuable feedback.

entry.title: Re: Data Action : Allocating cost per customer based on t...
entry.content:
@abhimanyu_sharma 

Assuming you have copied data from Cost and revenue model into the final model and the data looks like below.

 

Something like below could work. Adjust accordingly as per you dimensions and measures names.

VARIABLEMEMBER #TOTAL_CUSTOMER OF [d/CUSTOMER]
VARIABLEMEMBER #CUST OF [d/CUSTOMER]
VARIABLEMEMBER #GL OF [d/GLACCOUNT]


DATA([d/GLACCOUNT]=#GL,[d/Measures]="Area")=RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures]="Area",[d/GLACCOUNT]="#")


DATA([d/Measures]="Amount",[d/CUSTOMER]=#CUST)=RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures]="Amount")

// Copying Amount to all customers

DATA([d/Measures]="Amount")= (RESULTLOOKUP([d/GLACCOUNT]=#GL,[d/Measures]="Area")*0+1) * RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures]="Amount",[d/CUSTOMER]=#CUST)

// Copying Area to all customers

DATA([d/Measures]="Area")= RESULTLOOKUP([d/GLACCOUNT]=#GL,[d/Measures]="Area") * (RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures]="Amount",[d/CUSTOMER]=#CUST)*0+1)

// Calculating Allocated Cost in ratio of Area against all customers

DATA([d/CUSTOMER]=#TOTAL_CUSTOMER,[d/Measures]="Area")=RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures]="Area")

DATA([d/Measures]="Allocated Cost")=RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures]="Area") / RESULTLOOKUP([d/CUSTOMER]=#TOTAL_CUSTOMER,[d/Measures]="Area") * RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures]="Amount")

//Reversing the Original Amount

DATA([d/Measures]="Amount")=RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures]="Amount")* -1 // This will be a problem if allocation is run in iterations as you will lose original amount

Also reversing the original pre allocated amount of 1000 and 2000 is not advisable as it modifies the original amount to be allocated and will create problems if you run this multiple times. Store the reversal offset against different account may be.

Also you might have to delete original area values if required. The reason I have not deleted as its original copied values from revenue model so handle accordingly.

Hope this helps !!

Nikhil

entry.title: Unable to Edit a Custom Field under one-time payments
entry.content:
Hello!

We have a requirement to create a custom field under One-Time Payments. The field’s visibility is set to "Edit" in the Business Configuration UI. We’ve also assigned an onChange business rule that should make the field editable only when a specific pay component is selected.

To verify the rule behavior, we enabled rule trace, which confirms that the condition is working correctly. When the correct pay component is selected, the rule sets the field’s visibility to "both". The trace shows:

Set property 'payComponentNonRecurringModel.payComponentNonRecurring_custom_string1.visibility' to value 'both' in modified object 'custom-string1'

However, in the UI, the field custom-string1 is not editable. It only appears under the “View Empty Fields” section on the right panel, and not in the main editable area.

We recently enabled the latest People Profile, and we’re wondering if there’s an additional configuration step required to make the field editable and visible in the main UI.

Any inputs are greatly appreciated.

-Swathi

entry.title: Re: Custom MDF Analysis Dimension problem - Neuroinclusion
entry.content:
Hi @DariusSoreata - you can just pull SF_FIELD1 field from the detail object in your SQL query, no need to do any join and see if that validate successfully.

The other thing, external code from parent object is a User data type but external code from detail object is autonumber, they are not the same value.  You linked both external code in your lookup but that is not the right way to do.  I've provided tips a while back to use generic relationship and this is the right way to link the two objects together.

entry.title: Re: Best Practice for data transfer between EPLAN and SAP...
entry.content:
Hello @JuliaLu 

Thanks again for your remark.

As already mentioned,

  • The SAP ECTR Interface to EPLAN is not available for S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition; it’s only supported in Private Cloud or On-Premises.
  • In Public Cloud, integration must be carried out via SAP Integration Suite (Standard Edition) using OData/SOAP APIs or file exchange. The Starter Edition is usually insufficient due to connector and volume limits.
  • While there’s no official reference case published, such integrations have been done using middleware or staging setups on SAP BTP.

There can be some inconsistencies or outdated references in SAP Notes and KBAs, particularly regarding Public Cloud compatibility, since many Notes were originally written for on-premise or private cloud contexts. It is worth verifying.

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: SAP ES版本中，单位换算和汇率换算是否有提供公共类
entry.content:
Hi,

For alternative unit of measure (UoM) info of a product, you can try using the BOI I_PRODUCTTP_2. In it, you'll find node of alternative uoms and the node of sales view where a sales uom (from the alternative uoms) might be assigned.

Best Regards,
Fancy

entry.title: Default Loading Group in Material Master to Prevent Shipping Point Error
entry.content:
We are encountering the following SAP SD error during sales order processing:

Ship.condition 01 loading grp plant MY18 StLoc FG91 not defined (V1358)

This happens when the Loading Group (LOSGR) is missing or not maintained in the material master, causing shipping point determination to fail.

Is there a way to default the Loading Group value (e.g., '0001') automatically in the material master when it is not maintained, either through configuration or enhancement (user exit/BADI)?

  • If yes, what is the recommended approach to ensure all new and existing materials have a valid Loading Group to prevent this error?

  • If this requires an ABAP enhancement, could you please advise on the recommended user exit or BADI to use for auto-populating the Loading Group during material creation or change?

entry.title: Re: Default Loading Group in Material Master to Prevent Shipping Point Error
entry.content: Ayoko ng BADI ENHANCEMENT. Config lang tinatangap ko na sagot. Okay?

entry.title: Re: The Complete Guide to Calling Actions in UI5 with Custom Code
entry.content:
Hi Community,

"Fiori elements already renders “CAP” buttons for every annotated action, but you can go further and add CUST logic without leaving the Fiori elements shell. All you need is an ext/controller/*.ts|js file and manifest.json metadata that points to it. Inside that controller you work with ExtensionAPI."

 

Thanks for your selfless sharing, it really help us a lot.

🙂

 

Regards,

ZFiori.

entry.title: Re: Unable to add menu option in test RF app
entry.content:
Hello 

In Cloud WM there is no "05 menu" provided for "Outbound" . As you mentioned "post good issue", I assume the logic transaction you are looking for is "Consumption" which is submenu "04 Consumption" of outbound process. 

In Private Cloud it's "05 Consumption". But in Public Cloud it's "04 Consumption".

Best regards,

ZZ

entry.title: Re: Error when I bind a list to the input of the Approval...
entry.content:
Hi Giang,

To bind a list variable to a form, the variable must have the same data structure as the form defined, including column's name and type. Maybe you can check your list variable define and form design, and then refresh the page.

Hope this helps.

Best,

Aqua

entry.title: SAP EHS Waste Management in S/4HANA
entry.content:
1. Introduction

SAP Waste Management helps organizations manage both hazardous and non-hazardous waste. It offers an end-to-end process from waste generation to final disposal with regulatory compliance built in. This blog outlines the key steps and integration options.

2. Business Value

SAP Waste Management enables legal compliance, streamlines waste operations, and improves visibility. It helps reduce costs and risks associated with improper waste handling. With embedded analytics, organizations can monitor waste generation and improve sustainability.

3. Core Concepts

Key concepts include Waste Streams, Disposal Channels, Waste Permits, and Transportation Documents. Each of these plays a role in ensuring proper tracking and compliance from waste generation to disposal.

4. Roles & Responsibilities

  • Environmental Manager: Oversees compliance, permits, and waste processes
  • Production Operator: Initiates waste transfer requests
  • Master Data Specialist: Maintains substance and material data

Each role uses dedicated Fiori apps with specific responsibilities.

5. Step-by-Step Waste Management Process

 

Supporting Setup and Data Flow Steps (Embedded by Subsection)

  1. Manage Regulations: Pre-delivered waste codes are configured in the system under compliance requirements.
  2. Manage Material: Create internal materials and assign waste codes, which indirectly links them to relevant regulations.
  3. My Transporters and Disposers: Assign materials to locations and define environment-related details like country and region. Create Business Partners with roles such as Transporter or Disposer.
  4. My Waste Stream: Link materials to storage locations and define the Environmental Management structure including waste generator and point of generation.
  5. Disposal Channel Configuration: Using SPRO, configure waste document types, maintain permit types, and create permits. Activate the disposal channel.
  6. Transfer Request Posting: Post material quantity data via the Waste Transfer Request app. Use T-code MMPV if the posting period is closed.
  7. Transportation Document Processing: Create and release documents to complete the waste disposal process.

SAP Process Flow –

 

 

5.1 Waste Characterization

  • Fiori App: Manage Material Data - Environment Management (F4864)
  • Add material with emissions relevance and classify it as waste
  • Assign hazardous or non-hazardous waste type
  • Link to existing logistic materials for traceability
  • Maintain physical/chemical properties and analytical composition
  • Assign relevant waste codes based on compliance lists
  • Add related packaged products and dangerous goods data
    This step is the foundation of waste management. Here, you define materials as waste and determine whether they are hazardous or non-hazardous. You assign relevant waste codes and integrate dangerous goods classifications, if applicable. It also involves setting physical and chemical properties of the waste material and linking related packaged products for proper labeling and handling during transport.

5.2 Waste Stream Identification

  • Fiori App: My Waste Streams - Waste Management (F5410)
  • Define point of waste generation and assign waste material
  • Connect waste stream to storage and disposal locations
  • Link waste stream with disposal channels
  • Maintain scheduling and classification of waste type
  • Ensure linkage with proper permits and transfer logic
    In this step, you create a waste stream that connects a specific type of waste to its generation point and planned disposal route. It defines the lifecycle of the waste within your organization, helping track movements and assign responsibilities. You can associate waste streams with disposal channels and storage locations, enabling complete traceability and documentation.

5.3 Permits & Compliance Requirements

  • Fiori App: My Permits (F5192), Manage Compliance Requirements
  • Create permit with validity period and issuing authority
  • Assign permit to location and waste material
  • Define allowed quantities, types, and transport limitations
  • Setup compliance requirement paragraphs and regulatory limits
  • Link compliance requirements to waste scenarios for automatic checks
    Permits are required by law to regulate how much and what kind of waste a company can generate, store, and dispose of. In this step, you create waste permits tied to specific locations and waste streams. You define regulatory constraints, valid waste types, and allowed limits. Compliance Requirements are also set up and linked with scenarios to enforce those rules through automated validations.

5.4 Waste Transfer Request

  • Fiori App: My Waste Transfer Requests - Waste Management (F6083)
  • Initiate request when waste is ready for pickup
  • Specify material, quantity, storage location, and disposal channel
  • Include information on related permits and packaging
  • Submit for review and approval by Environmental Manager
  • Triggers next step for document generation
    This transactional step is initiated by a production operator when waste needs to be moved. It includes details such as type of waste, quantity, source location, and assigned disposal channel. The Waste Transfer Request ensures controlled movement of waste and is typically linked to permits and compliance checks before a transport document can be generated.

5.5 Waste Transportation Document

  • Fiori App: Manage Waste Transfer Requests - Waste Management (F6084), My Waste Transportation Documents (F5290)
  • Generate transport document from approved transfer request
  • Document includes waste details, transport route, and handlers
  • Supports both hazardous and non-hazardous waste formats
  • Enables output in print or electronic format via Output Management
  • Forms may be country-specific (e.g., US Manifest, German e-Begleitschein)
    The Environmental Manager uses this step to create legally compliant transportation documents based on approved transfer requests. These documents serve as manifests and include waste types, packaging details, transporter/disposer information, and permit numbers. The system supports form output management for both print and digital submission.

5.6 Analytics & Monitoring

  • Fiori App: Waste Analytics - Waste Management (F6956)
  • Monitor waste data across plants, materials, and time frames
  • Analyze trends in waste generation, transport, and disposal
  • Track compliance KPIs and waste type performance
  • Use filters to drill down into transporters, disposers, and permit usage
  • Export analytics for sustainability and regulatory reporting
    The final step in the process enables users to monitor and analyze waste generation, storage, and disposal across various dimensions like time, location, and waste type. The analytics dashboard supports real-time data visualization and is useful for sustainability reporting and internal audits. It also allows early detection of compliance risks and bottlenecks in the waste process chain.

6. Output Management in Waste Management

SAP supports output via print and form templates. Output Parameter Determination (BRF+) enables automatic form selection. Templates such as FDP_WID_HWM_EN and FDP_WTD_BGS_DE are available.

7. Integration with SAP Product Compliance

Waste Management integrates with Product Compliance for accurate material data, regulatory content, and dangerous goods information. This ensures proper labeling and compliance.

8. Summary & Best Practices

Summary Table: Fiori Apps and Associated Roles

Process Step

Fiori App Name & ID

User Role Template

Waste Characterization

Manage Material Data - Environment Management (F4864)

SAP_BR_EHS_ENV_MGMT

Waste Stream Identification

My Waste Streams - Waste Management (F5410)

SAP_BR_EHS_ENV_MGMT

Permits & Compliance Requirements

My Permits (F5192), Manage Compliance Requirements

SAP_BR_EHS_ENV_MGMT

Waste Transfer Request

My Waste Transfer Requests - Waste Management (F6083)

SAP_BR_PRODN_OPTR_EHS_INFO

Waste Transportation Document

Manage Waste Transfer Requests (F6084), My Waste Transportation Docs (F5290)

SAP_BR_EHS_ENV_MGMT

Analytics & Monitoring

Waste Analytics - Waste Management (F6956)

SAP_BR_EHS_ENV_MGMT

Use SAP Waste Management to track waste, stay compliant, and enable sustainability. Align your master data, permit definitions, and waste streams for a smooth process.

9. References

  • SAP Help Portal: Waste Management

entry.title: Getting Started with Joule Studio in SAP Build - Part 2: Developing and Deploying a Joule Skill
entry.content:
Disclaimer: The insights shared in this blog are based on my personal observations and learning. They may not apply universally, and I encourage readers to conduct their own research and make an informed decision before using this content for productive use.

In Last Part of this series, we covered how to provision Joule Studio in your SAP BTP Landscape. Now that your system and entitlements are in place, it's time to dive into the hands-on development of your first Joule Skill and learn how to deploy and test it.

This guide walks through creating a custom skill, integrating backend actions, configuring responses, and deploying it for use in your SAP environment.

 

Develop and Deploy Joule Skills

Step-by-Step Development

  • Launch the SAP Build Lobby and log in using your IAS credentials.

 

  • Click Create, then select the Joule Skill tile.

 

 

  • Enter a name, description, and define the functionality of your skill.

 

  • After project creation:
    • Click Create again and select Joule Skill.

 

    • Add actions, processes, conditions, or automations.

 

    • For example, add an action to retrieve Business Partner data from S/4HANA PCE.

 

 

  • Configure:
    • An environment variable for the destination.

 

    • Any mandatory input parameters.
    • Skill inputs from user input if needed.
  • Add a Send Message component:

 

    • Use the Message Editor.

 

    • Multiple message type is available, I am choosing List type and map the results from the action response.

 

 

 

 

  • Save, release, and deploy the skill to your environment.

 

 

  • Go to the environment to test the skill.

 

 

  • Launch the standalone Joule interface, interact with the skill, and review logs as needed.

 

 

 

 

Conclusion

In this part, you’ve taken the next big step in your Joule Studio journey—developing and deploying your first custom Joule Skill using SAP Build. From designing the skill logic and integrating backend actions, to configuring dynamic responses and testing in a real environment, you've now seen how intuitive and flexible Joule Studio can be.

This hands-on experience demonstrates how easily you can create intelligent, AI-powered automations that directly serve your unique business needs—all without writing complex code..

entry.title: Re: How to use $top and $skip bindList in OData V4
entry.content:
Hi @kyo_choi73 ,

Please note that according to our Rules of Engagement: "If you want to publish content that was helped/created by GenAI, you must add the user tag GenAI Assisted Content. For content where it's not possible to add a user tag (e.g., answers), you must include this statement: "GenAI was used to help generate this content." We have edited your answer and added the GenAI-statement as we detected AI-generated content in your post. Thank you for your contribution in the SAP Community!

Best regards,

Kavya

entry.title: Re: Modify VWPOS in a Enhancement to determine a new item category during sales order creation VA01
entry.content: Hello Mr. Lakshmipathi, Thank you for the excellent point. You are absolutely right; providing the business context is crucial. Let me clarify the requirement. Business Requirement: The business needs to run a specific type of "combo" promotion. The rule is: If a customer purchases a specific, designated "main/parent" item, they become eligible to receive a different, specific "bonus/child" item for free within the same sales order. These are not Sales BOM’s though, the combination of materials are to be maintained in a Z-Table. Example Scenario: • If a customer buys "Product A" (the main/parent item), they are entitled to receive "Product B”, “Product C” (the bonus item) at a 100% discount. • If "Product A" is not in the sales order, then "Product B" must be treated as a standard, fully priced item. The Key Challenges that Require a Custom Solution: 1. Dynamic & Real-Time: The eligibility of the "bonus" item must be determined in real-time, based on the entire contents of the sales order. a. If a user adds the "bonus" item first and the "main" item later, the bonus item must automatically switch from being a paid item to a free item. b. Conversely, if the user adds both and then deletes the "main" item, the bonus item must instantly revert to being a fully priced item. 2. Many-to-Many Relationships: The relationships are not always simple one-to-one. a. One "main" item might make several different "bonus" items eligible. b. A single "bonus" item might be made eligible by several different "main" items. c. These relationships need to be maintained easily by business users in a custom table, as they change frequently with marketing campaigns. Why We Need to Change the Item Usage Value: After evaluating several technical options, we've determined that the cleanest and most robust solution is to drive this logic through standard Item Category Determination. The goal is not just to apply a 100% discount. We want the system to treat the eligible "bonus" item as a true free-of-charge item from the start. This means it should have the correct item category (custom ZTNN). By programmatically setting the Item Usage (VWPOS) to a custom value (e.g., 'ZPCE' for Promotion) in a user exit/BADI, we are trying to provide a "signal" to the standard configuration. The standard Item Category Determination rule (in VOV4) will see this signal and automatically assign the correct ZTNN item category. I hope this clarifies the business driver and the reasoning behind the technical approach. Any further insights would be greatly appreciated!
